characters.name: Mr. Utterson
characters.description: A man of a rugged countenance, cold, scanty and embarrassed in discourse; backward in sentiment; lean, long, dusty, dreary and yet somehow lovable.

characters.name: Mr. Richard Enfield
characters.description: Mr. Utterson's distant kinsman, known for his Sunday walks with Mr. Utterson.

characters.name: Mr. Hyde
aliases: the man of the name of Hyde
characters.description: A man with something wrong with his appearance; something displeasing, something downright detestable.

characters.name: the girl
characters.description: A girl of maybe eight or ten who was trampled by Mr. Hyde.

characters.name: the doctor
aliases: the usual cut and dry apothecary
characters.description: A doctor with a strong Edinburgh accent, who turned sick and white with the desire to kill Mr. Hyde.

characters.name: the child's father
characters.description: The father of the girl who was trampled by Mr. Hyde.

characters.name: Richard
characters.description: A young man who converses with Mr. Utterson.

characters.name: Dr. Jekyll
characters.description: A doctor and friend of Mr. Utterson, whose will is a point of concern.

characters.name: Edward Hyde
characters.description: A mysterious and sinister figure associated with Dr. Jekyll.

characters.name: Dr. Lanyon
characters.description: A hearty, healthy, red-faced gentleman and old friend of Mr. Utterson and Dr. Jekyll.

characters.name: Mr. Enfield
characters.description: A character whose tale is recalled by Mr. Utterson.

characters.name: Poole
characters.description: An elderly servant of Dr. Jekyll.

characters.name: Sir Danvers Carew
characters.description: An aged, beautiful gentleman who becomes a victim of Mr. Hyde's violence.

characters.name: Lanyon
characters.description: A colleague of Dr. Jekyll, described as a 'hide-bound pedant.'

characters.name: the maid
characters.description: A maid servant who witnesses the murder of Sir Danvers Carew.

characters.name: the officer
characters.description: A police officer involved in the investigation of Sir Danvers Carew's murder.

characters.name: Henry Jekyll
characters.description: A doctor with a chemical interest, friend of Mr. Utterson.

characters.name: Inspector Newcomen
characters.description: An inspector from Scotland Yard.

characters.name: Mr. Guest
characters.description: Mr. Utterson's head clerk and a handwriting expert.

characters.name: Old Woman
characters.description: An ivory-faced and silvery-haired woman who opens the door at Mr. Hyde's residence.

characters.name: Bradshaw
characters.description: A footman who is nervous about the situation.

characters.name: housemaid
characters.description: A housemaid who breaks into hysterical whimpering.

characters.name: cook
characters.description: The cook who is relieved to see Mr. Utterson.

characters.name: knife-boy
characters.description: A young servant who assists Poole.

characters.name: Dr. Denman
characters.description: The previous owner of the surgical theatre.

characters.name: Dr. Henry Jekyll
characters.description: A doctor with a private cabinet and involved in mysterious experiments.

characters.name: Hastie Lanyon
characters.description: The narrator of the letter, a colleague of Dr. Jekyll.

characters.name: Hyde
characters.description: A mysterious and unsettling figure associated with Dr. Jekyll.

characters.name: Carew
characters.description: A person mentioned as being murdered by Hyde.

characters.name: Utterson
characters.description: A person addressed by Lanyon in the letter.

characters.name: Sir Danvers
characters.description: A man high in public estimation who was murdered.

characters.name: Driver
characters.description: A cab driver who encounters Hyde.

characters.name: Woman
characters.description: A woman who offers Hyde a box of lights.

book_metadata.title: The Strange Case Of Dr. Jekyll And Mr. Hyde
book_metadata.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
